The #CombatCOVID19Challenge is simple:
1⃣ Pick an act of kindness to help your community #CombatCOVID19
2⃣ Post a video of yourself completing the challenge
3⃣ Challenge 2-3 others to join the challenge http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1250091523338797067/img/3DHs6ZlS4zHXG0TW.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1250091523338797067/vid/480x270/oPBxebNPDHU3sxM_.mp4?tag=13

Too many employers misclassify their workers as independent contractors in order to deny them basic protections and improve their bottom lines.

The pandemic has exposed this longstanding issue and Congress needs to crack down—now. https://twitter.com/TonyaJoRiley/status/1249723136897138688 QT @TonyaJoRiley Warren and Khanna Essential Worker Bill of Rights includes “delivery drivers, warehouse workers and transportation workers” in a clear nod to gig workers http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EVfojZqXYAAt5bY.jpg

How & when to modify physical distancing orders should & will be made by Governors. 

Federal guidelines issued by ⁦@CDCgov⁩ & ⁦@WhiteHouse⁩ will be very influential. 

But the Constitution & common sense dictates these decisions be made at the state level. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1250053099219226624/pu/img/M97ajNOjxAV-RnFx.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1250053099219226624/pu/vid/480x270/e7SvtAXqyLfM3Onz.mp4?tag=10

Stay home! 

But when you can’t stay home—stay safe. 

Sending strength from my family to yours. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EVnHavrWAAExpVN.jpg

The Treasury Department is allowing banks to seize stimulus checks from the people who need them most. This is fundamentally wrong. People—not banks—need relief now.
https://prospect.org/coronavirus/banks-can-grab-stimulus-check-pay-debts/

Chris Smalls organized Amazon warehouse workers to demand protective gear, paid sick leave, and workplace safety.

Rather than change its policies, Amazon fired him.

I say to Jeff Bezos: Enough! We will not tolerate CEOs who intimidate workers fighting for their human rights. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EVmAq0uXQAAIoxn.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1250170563693367297/vid/320x320/JmIKLhyM2f32gJkv.mp4?tag=13

The right to organize is a bedrock of our economy, responsible for many of the greatest advances achieved by workers over generations. Workers should be free to organize and strike for workplace protections without fear of being fired. https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/04/13/amazon-workers-fired/

Instead of firing employees who want justice, maybe Jeff Bezos—the richest man in the world—can focus on providing his workers with paid sick leave, a safe workplace, and a livable planet. https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/04/13/amazon-workers-fired/

This pandemic has shed light on something many of us have known: there are deep existing disparities in our country’s health care system, especially when it comes to the maternal health of Black women.

It's critical that we confront these realities with immediate solutions. https://twitter.com/Essence/status/1250066434501357570 QT @Essence In the latest installment of  #KamalasCorner, @KamalaHarris tackles the Black Maternal Health Crisis as we recognize Black Maternal Health Week. https://www.essence.com/feature/black-maternal-health-crisis-kamala-harris/

Her NYC district is among the worst hit by fatalities and also, she says, is full of working class families who cannot afford funerals.  She's asking FEMA to help pay.

If we force Americans to choose between voting this November or staying safe from the virus—then democracy as we know it will be lost. https://twitter.com/nowthisnews/status/1250046145314734080 QT @nowthisnews Sen. @EWarren shares 4 simple steps Americans can take now to make sure they have the right to vote safely during and after the pandemic http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EVhUP1mUUAEOMlF.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1249841054196494337/vid/320x320/LOZD5bVoETwezO-x.mp4?tag=13

Update on Utah's approved #PaycheckProtectionProgram loans:
 
✅12,914 Utah employers
✅$2,617,066,864
 
This is great news for our small businesses. However, this money is quickly running out. I urge my colleagues to come together to get @SBAgov more money for these loans. https://twitter.com/SenatorRomney/status/1247987073790943235 QT @SenatorRomney As of last night, 3,489 Utah employers have received $718,878,690 through the #PaycheckProtectionProgram—forgivable loans to ease the burdens of #COVID19. As the Senate continues work on further relief measures, I will keep pushing for additional support for our small businesses.
